channel.title: Tech Velocity: PC Hardware, AI, & China Silicon News (Aggregated)
channel.description: Comprehensive daily news covering the latest in PC hardware, AI co-processors, Chinese silicon developments (Moore Threads, Loongson), and links to top external tech news feeds.

item.title: Direct RSS Links for Major Tech Publications (Copy These)
item.description:
For live, real-time content from major tech sites, use these verified public RSS feed links directly:

  • WCCFtech (Main Feed): https://wccftech.com/feed
  • Tom's Hardware (Latest News): https://www.tomshardware.com/feeds/latest
  • TechRadar (Main Feed): https://www.techradar.com/feeds.xml
  • Pandaily (China Tech News): https://pandaily.com/feed/
  • AnandTech (Main Feed): https://www.anandtech.com/feed/
  • The Verge (All Posts): https://www.theverge.com/rss/index.xml

item.title: Intel's 18A Node Yield Exceeds Projections, Confirms Arrow Lake Production Schedule
item.description: Intel’s latest investor briefing revealed that the **18A manufacturing process** is ahead of schedule, with key quality metrics indicating high yields. This greenlights the aggressive ramp-up for the **Arrow Lake CPU** lineup, focusing heavily on integrating the next generation of power-efficient **AI NPUs** crucial for the AI PC ecosystem.

item.title: AMD Zen 5 (Strix Point) Mobile APUs Set to Challenge Lunar Lake with Advanced NPU
item.description: Fresh leaks concerning AMD’s **Strix Point mobile APUs (Zen 5)** suggest an NPU capable of **50+ TOPS**, directly targeting Microsoft's stringent requirements for flagship Windows AI features. The integrated **RDNA 3.5 graphics** core is also expected to significantly boost on-the-go gaming performance, setting up a major mobile platform battle with Intel's Lunar Lake.

item.title: NVIDIA Blackwell B200 Successor Details Emerge: Focus on 16-Hi HBM3e Stacks
item.description: Reports from supply chain sources indicate NVIDIA's post-Blackwell strategy is centering on maximizing memory density. The upcoming data center GPU is rumored to utilize massive **16-Hi HBM3e stacks** to achieve unprecedented memory capacities and bandwidth, essential for the next evolutionary stage of **multimodal LLMs** and massive AI inference workloads.

item.title: Phison E26 Controller Powers First 14 GB/s PCIe Gen5 SSDs, Hitting Market Q4
item.description: The long-awaited **PCIe Gen5 SSDs** capable of sequential read speeds up to **14 GB/s** are finally launching this quarter. These drives, utilizing the highly optimized Phison E26 controller paired with new 232-layer TLC NAND, demonstrate the bleeding edge of consumer storage, making the jump from 10 GB/s to 14 GB/s a tangible reality.

item.title: Moore Threads Unveils Enhanced MUSA Architecture for Cloud-Native Gaming
item.description: Moore Threads has updated its **MUSA (Moore Threads Unified System Architecture)** platform with a stronger focus on cloud-native environments and domestic Linux OS compatibility. The goal is to provide a viable domestic alternative to international GPU solutions for both enterprise workloads and the burgeoning Chinese **cloud gaming** sector.

item.title: Loongson 3A6000 Benchmark: Competitive Single-Thread Performance Against Older Intel/AMD
item.description: A new performance review of the Chinese-developed **Loongson 3A6000** CPU shows its **LoongArch** core achieving single-threaded performance roughly equivalent to Intel's 10th-generation or AMD's Zen 2 architectures. This milestone is a major step for domestic self-sufficiency, particularly for government and state-owned enterprise deployment.
